content: yarn change/eyelet row ws using old yarn slip_stitch move yarn to the back with new yarn *k2tog yo* repeat until last 3 stiches k2tog k 65 sts  continue row 1 and 2 with new yarn  when your scarf is the desired length remembering that it will stretch out longer with blocking/wearing bind off and weave in ends wash and block as desired © crystal bergstrom sonnet of the moon tips  you will always slip the first stitch at the beginning of a row you will always increase or decrease at the end of a row pay attention at the beginning and end to make sure you don t miss any of these the rest of the time just knit away  if your slipped stitch edge is loose or wobbly try this after you slip the first stitch onto your right needle with the yarn in front bring your yarn to the back and insert your needle into the next stitch as if to knit before you knit the stitch give the yarn a little tug don t strangle it just snug it up to the needle a bit then continue knitting the stitch this will keep your edge nice and neat without being too tight  if you re trying to use as much yarn as you can before a color change it helps to know how much yarn it takes to knit two row for me each row takes about a yard of yarn if i have 2 yds left after finishing a right side row i know i ll have enough to knit another ws and rs row before working my eyelet/color change row  if you need help with any of the stitches feel free to ask me or what i usually do look up the stitch on youtube those generous and talented knitting ladies have gotten me through every new stitch since i started knitting © crystal bergstrom sonnet of the moon
